newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end down as blue chips tumble.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end down as blue chips tumble.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended down on Tuesday as selling in blue chips, especially Pakistan Telecommunications Company Ltd (PTCL), offset new accounts day buying, dealers said.
The Karachi 100-share index fell 13.88 points, or 0.92 percent, to end at 1,489.84. Gainers beat losers 166 to 110.
"Weakness in PTCL on fears of a further delay in its privatisation dragged down the index despite new accounts day buying," one dealer said.
Dewan Salman Fibres fell 0.95 rupees to 32.80 and PTCL 1.20 to 28.35. -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192
